preqs: LAW5000 or LAW5080 or LAW5081, LAW7265 or LAW5002, LAW5005 and LAW5004 (for students beginning in 2015 or later)

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {3387, L6005}
For COURSE_CODE IN {3387} Do Must have passed 2 units in {LAW5000, LAW5005, LAW5080, LAW7212, LAW7429, LAW7470} Otherwise Must have passed 3 units in {LAW5000, LAW5004, LAW5005, LAW5080}

description: The unit introduces students to the nature and function of equity in the modern Australian legal system. Students learn about the relationship between equity and the common law, and study the key doctrines of equity. These include: equitable assignments, breach of confidence, fiduciary relationships and breach of fiduciary duty, third party liability and tracing, personal and proprietary remedies in equity and equitable defences.
